posts.name:
✒️Claire M. Davis🖋️
✒️Claire M. Davis🖋️
posts.content:
Is using spell check enough to proof-read your resume for errors? 

Spell check is a great way to start but always have another set of eyes on your document from a trusted confidante. This will also help ensure that your resume is easy to understand by anyone who reads it.

A win-win.

________________________
Hi, I'm ️Claire M. Davis️

And after 16,000 Medical Sales Resumes, riding 5X layoffs in the medical sales industry, and helping 105 of 110 clients land roles last year -- I'm feeling pretty solid that I can sort out your complicated career story for you.

I've heard it all. Trust me.

So if you're looking to...Get In...Get Back In...Stay In...Medical Sales -- and you need a hand, send me a DM.

I'm ready to make this a whole lot easier on you.

comments.commentText: Spellcheck is only the start. When I proofread, I change phrases for better clarity. Always take a 2-3 hour break after writing your resume, and then proofread it with fresh eyes. You will find many areas for improvement.
Kashaf Noor that’s a great add — a little time away for a refresh really helps!
Another reader can often notice things that you can't, ️Claire M. Davis️! Reading the resume aloud can also help you catch typos.
Job Search Like a Pro yes, exactly!’

posts.commentAdded: Great advice, Claire! A fresh perspective can truly elevate a resume. Let’s ensure every story stands out in the competitive medical sales field!

posts.name:
Dan Goodman
Dan Goodman
posts.content:
New trend, PIP’d out of the blue, weeks before scheduled paternity leave. 

Sad to report I have heard more than 20 stories of new fathers-to-be being placed on PIPs just prior to paternity leave. It is some of the most cold-hearted and inhumane actions I’ve seen.

The intent is not to improve, it is to set up a termination for when they return. It is to retaliate against the employee for taking extended paternity leave. A benefit the company offers but don’t you dare take them up on the entirety of their generous benefit.

I know it sounds hard to believe, but I have personally spoken to way too many new fathers who have experienced it to consider it an outlier.

The PIP is often out of the blue, undeserved, and unachievable. The stress it causes the employee, his pregnant wife, and their unborn child is outrageous and harmful.

For what, to be able to justify terminating the employee when they come back from leave because they were already on a PIP before they left.

Generous benefits are great until you fully utilize them and your manager does not support it. I'm not telling people to not take paternity leave, just assess the culture and mindset of the organization and its leadership when doing to.

comments.commentText: Awful. I wonder how lawyers would view this given the protected class within familial status discrimination
It's truly disheartening to hear about this trend. No one should face such stress during such a pivotal life moment. Organizations must do better.

posts.commentAdded: This highlights a troubling trend that undermines family values in the workplace. Companies must prioritize support over sabotage.

posts.name:
PRADEEP KUMAR GUPTAA
PRADEEP KUMAR GUPTAA
posts.content:
𝙀𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙬𝙤𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙧 𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙢𝙞𝙡𝙡𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙞𝙧𝙚𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙠 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙚𝙮?

Millionaire and bank

A distinguished man walked into a bank in New York and asked for a loan officer. He told him that he was leaving for the Philippines for two weeks and wanted to take out a loan of $5,000. The bank employee responded that the bank would need a form of security for the loan.

The man handed over the keys to a new Ferrari parked on the street in front of the bank. The inspector checked the numbers and everything and agreed to accept the car as collateral.

Officials laughed at the guy who kept a $250,000 Ferrari as collateral for a $5,000 loan.

The Ferrari was parked in the bank's underground garage. Two weeks later the guy came back and repaid the $5,000 plus interest, which totaled $15.41.

The bank's loan officer said, “Sir, we were very happy about this deal, but we are a little puzzled. While you were away, we checked and discovered that you are a millionaire. What's the point in you worrying about a $5,000 loan?

The millionaire replied: “Where else in New York can I park my car for $15.41 for two weeks? "

The rich always stay rich because they know a lot more about money management than ordinary people. All millionaires care about the little things.

How do you manage the "little things" in your finances? Share your thoughts in the comments!

,
,
,
,

comments.commentText: Makes you realize the importance of being resourceful with your assets

posts.commentAdded: This story highlights the brilliance of smart financial management. It’s all about making the most of every dollar—great reminder! 💡💰

posts.content:
𝐄𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐅𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐒𝐮𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬 – 𝐓𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐕𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐀𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 
At TechEdge Dynamics, we help startups thrive by guiding founders through the crucial early stages of development. Our
/
for startups turns innovative ideas into actionable strategies, helping you overcome challenges like product development, market validation, and growth planning. From concept to launch, we ensure every step aligns with your vision, giving you the confidence to succeed in today’s competitive startup ecosystem.

But how do you transform an idea into a viable venture? 
It starts with the Idea-to-Venture Formula, a roadmap for growth!

 Step 1: The Power of an Idea
Every successful venture begins with an idea, inspired by what you already have.
 Formula: Idea = Anything + You
We work with you to refine your idea, ensuring it’s both innovative and actionable.

 Step 2: Turning Ideas into Opportunities
Ideas only become valuable when you take action. This means real steps like building a prototype, making deals, or forming partnerships.
 Formula: Opportunity = Idea + Action
We help you identify the right actions to take and move your idea forward.

️ Step 3: Action that Drives Interaction
Action means creating meaningful interactions, with customers, investors, or partners. These interactions bring your idea to life.
 Formula: Action = Interaction on/with Money, Products, or Partners
We’ll help you secure funding, build products, and create partnerships to fuel your growth.

 Step 4: From Opportunity to Viable Venture
Commitments turn opportunities into a real, thriving business. This means launching your product, hiring a team, and delivering results.
 Formula: Viable Venture = Opportunity + Commitment
We ensure your commitments align with your vision, setting you up for sustainable success.

 Ready to Start?
The Idea-to-Venture Formula is your guide to building something impactful and real. Withby your side, you’ll turn your idea into the next big success story. Let’s make it happen!
posts.commentAdded: Excited to see how the Idea-to-Venture Formula helps founders bring their innovative ideas to life! Lets turn vision into action! 🚀

posts.content:
Revolutionary AI-Powered Bionic Hand: Transforming Lives

Imagine having a hand that works almost like your own, powered by advanced AI! This AI-powered bionic hand is a game-changer for individuals with disabilities, bringing independence and ease back into everyday life.

 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗶𝘁?
 Human-like movements: With six motors, it replicates the natural dexterity of the human hand, simplifying complex tasks.
 Real-time adaptability: With 24 sensors, it tracks muscle movements and adjusts instantly to meet the user’s needs.
 Personalized experience: Equipped with machine learning, the hand learns from the user over time, improving grip and functionality.

This innovation is not just about assistance; it’s about empowerment. Tasks like holding a cup of coffee, writing, or even tying shoelaces become simple again.

 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗠𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀:
It’s not just about technology—it’s about restoring confidence and enhancing lives. AI and robotics are proving to be powerful tools for greater accessibility and inclusion.

 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗧𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁𝘀:
What are your thoughts on how AI can help improve accessibility? Let’s discuss below!

Follow me for more stories on innovation and its impact on lives.
posts.commentAdded: Incredible innovation! This bionic hand truly illustrates how AI can enhance lives and empower individuals. Excited to see its impact! 🌟

posts.name:
Greg Sher
Greg Sher
posts.content:
Brace yourself for an uncomfortable truth.

Today, on 𝐌𝐋𝐊 𝐃𝐚𝐲, we honor a man who fought for justice, opportunity, and economic equality. But let’s get real—if Dr. King were alive today, he’d be furious.

Why?

Because all these years later, Black homeownership rates are as bad or nearly as bad as they were in 1968—the year the Fair Housing Act was passed:

Sixty years later, and we’re still watching Black and Hispanic families get shut out of the #1 wealth-building tool in America..

This system isn’t broken—it’s working exactly as it was designed to.

 Black and Hispanic borrowers are denied mortgages at nearly TWICE the rate of white applicants—with the same income and credit scores.
 Those who do get approved are often charged higher interest rates, adding up to tens of thousands of dollars lost over the life of a loan.
 Even the algorithms—the so-called “neutral” automated underwriting systems (AUS)—are coded with bias, disproportionately rejecting minority applicants.
 Let’s talk home insurance—a Black family buying a home in a historically redlined area often pays more for insurance than a white family in a similar financial situation.

You want to build wealth? Too bad—the system is rigged.

And here’s the kicker: Black buyers are told that if they just "fix their credit," "save more," and "work harder," they’ll get the same shot.

 That’s a lie.

This isn’t about “bad credit” or “financial literacy.” This is about decades of systemic discrimination that keep Black and Brown families locked out of homeownership—and locked out of generational wealth.

So what do we do?

We stop playing nice. We start demanding accountability.

 Lenders—Audit your underwriting models. If bias exists (and let’s be honest, it does), FIX IT.
 Regulators—Get some backbone. Enforce anti-discrimination laws like lives depend on it—because they do.
 Realtors & loan officers—Stop just “doing your job” and start advocating for change. If you see discrimination, CALL IT OUT.

Silence is complicity.

 The dream of homeownership shouldn’t be a privilege—it should be a right. But rights mean nothing without action.

Don’t just remember Dr. King today. Honor him by fighting for real change.

comments.commentText: This is one of the few "business" messages on MLK Jr.'s birthday that actually says something. Those who use his birthday as a form of "marketing" to show their progressive bonafides while daily acting against everything the man stood for (especially post 1966)...are the cringiest of sorts.

posts.commentAdded: An important reminder that Dr. Kings dream is still a work in progress. Let’s hold ourselves accountable and advocate for real change! #EquityMatters

posts.content:
What’s on your phone lock screen?

Time to change it. *I’m sharing mine below.

Your phone. It’s a tool. A weapon.

Something that can be used for good or mass evil.

You pick it up and see your lock screen 100 times per day.

Use it to your advantage.

Place your creed and your transformation on it.

You’ll burn it into your brain.

You’ll behave like you already have it.

You’ll stop at nothing to get it.

This is prime real estate. It’s not for fun.

This is what will become of your life.

Belief + reps = everything.

---

Share your phone background in the comments.

Or follow me for more →

If you do both, you delay global warming by 1000 years.

comments.commentText:
Your lock screen = your daily reminder. Make it count.
 hashtag
#MindsetMatters

4o

I like it, Colby

I have a whiteboard with my theme for the year on it. 

It's my daily reminder.

posts.commentAdded: Love this perspective! Our lock screens can serve as daily reminders of our goals. Heres mine—ready to inspire every time I unlock my phone!
